page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: { {LOCAL AUTHORITY:} Chapel St. Leonards Parish Council.Clerk:Mr. E. Ingham, 16 Clarendon Road, Skegness. {POPULATION:}Approximately 2,000 (Summer visiting 50,000 {TOURISM}) {Sea fishing}from Chapel Point in varying seasons has produced catches of Skate,Flounder,Sole,Cod,Small Halibut and Eels.Edible Crab have been caught in the clays.In the outfall and up to the first lock Dabs and Eels are caught in varying quantity. The main waterway forks at Wigg Lane,in both branches west of the locks there is good fresh water fishing,Roach,Perch and Pike being caught in good size and quantity.There is good fresh water fishing at the Boating Lake,800 yards south of Trunch Lane and at Hill View Lake,Hogsthorpe.
